Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experiementi

 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experiementing, and new job types were create

 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were lef

They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was comi

 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it t

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.

 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best.

And so, the survivors began to rebuild.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of every

 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To

It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived be

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.

 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.

 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked lie

 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamourized, cle

 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on.

It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more -

The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the econ

 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way.  They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, whe

 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger

Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visted the planet,

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.

 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were amazed. They found a world that was a mix of fantasy and science fiction. Power on all levels. They reported back to

But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were amazed. They found a world that was a mix of fantasy and science fiction. Power on all levels. They reported back to their government t

 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.

 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were amazed. They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were amazed. They found a world that was a mix of fantasy and science fiction. Power on all levels. They reported back to their government that they had found a planet of gods and fairies, and wonderful and terr

It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were amazed. They found a world that was a mix of fantasy and science fiction. Power on all levels. The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were amazed. They found a world that was a mix of fantasy and science fiction. Power on all levels. They reported back to their government that they had found a planet of gods and fairies, and wonderful and terrible power. Soon after that the huma

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were amazed. They found a world that was a mix of fantasy and science fiction. Power on all levels. They reported back to their government that they had found a planet of gods and fairies, and wonderful and terrible power. Soon after that the humans decided to hide t

 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were amazed. They found a world that was a mix of fantasy and science fiction. Power on all levels. They reported back to their government that they had found a planet of gods and fairies, and wonderful and terrible power. Soon after that the humans decided to hide their planet, stil

They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were amazed. They found a world that was a mix of fantasy and science fiction. Power on all levels. They reported back to their government that they had found a planet of gods and fairies, and wonderful and terrible power. Soon after that the humans decided to hide their planet, still fearful of the un

 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were amazed. They found a world that was a mix of fantasy and science fiction. Power on all levels. They reported back to their government that they had found a planet of gods and fairies, and wonderful and terrible power. Soon after that the humans decided to hide their planet, still fearful of the universe even centu

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were amazed. They found a world that was a mix of fantasy and science fiction. Power on all levels. They reported back to their government that they had found a planet of gods and fairies, and wonderful and terrible power. Soon after that the humans decided to hide their planet, still fearful of the universe even centuries later, even w

Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were amazed. They found a world that was a mix of fantasy and science fiction. Power on all levels. They reported back to their government that they had found a planet of gods and fairies, and wonderful and terrible power. Soon after that the humans decided to hide their planet, still fearful of the universe even centuries later, even with all of their p

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were amazed. They found a world that was a mix of fantasy and science fiction. Power on all levels. They reported back to their government that they had found a planet of gods and fairies, and wonderful and terrible power. Soon after that the humans decided to hide their planet, still fearful of the universe even centuries later, even with all of their power. 
The world of the Folk is a world of magic, and the Folk are a magical people.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were amazed. They found a world that was a mix of fantasy and science fiction. Power on all levels. They reported back to their government that they had found a planet of gods and fairies, and wonderful and terrible power. Soon after that the humans decided to hide their planet, still fearful of the universe even centuries later, even with all of their power.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were amazed. They found a world that was a mix of fantasy and science fiction. Power on all levels. They reported back to their government that they had found a planet of gods and fairies, and wonderful and terrible power. Soon after that the humans decided to hide their planet, still fearful of the universe even centuries later, even with all of their power. 
The world of the Folk is a world of magic, and the Folk are a magical people.

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were amazed. They found a world that was a mix of fantasy and science fiction. Power on all levels. They reported back to their government that they had found a planet of gods and fairies, and wonderful and terrible power. Soon after that the humans decided to hide their planet, still fearful of the universe even centuries later, even with all of their power. 
The world of the Folk is a world of magic, and the Folk are a magical people.
 So went the legends of the universe from then on. And they f

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way.  They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were amazed. They found a world that was a mix of fantasy and science fiction. Power on all levels. They reported back to their government that they had found a planet of gods and fairies, and wonderful and terrible power. Soon after that the humans decided to hide their planet, still fearful of the universe even centuries later, even with all of their power. 
The world of the Folk is a world of magic, and the Folk are a magical people.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree. 
And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were amazed. They found a world that was a mix of fantasy and science fiction. Power on all levels. They reported back to their government that they had found a planet of gods and fairies, and wonderful and terrible power. Soon after that the humans decided to hide their planet, still fearful of the universe even centuries later, even with all of their power.

And so, the survivors began to rebuild.
 Maybe it was the use of magic, or maybe the thought that they were going back to the Medieval ages was in the back of everyone's mind. But the survivors began to rebuild in a very different way. To anyone who had lived before the alien invasion it would have looked like a glamorized, cleaned up fantasy world. Style - clothing, hair, building, decor and more - changed as did the economic system and even the government.   

The survivors began to call themselves "The Folk". And centuries later, when another, younger species of alien visited the planet, they were amazed. They found a world that was a mix of fantasy and science fiction. Power on all levels. They reported back to their government that they had found a planet of gods and fairies, and wonderful and terrible power. Soon after that the humans decided to hide their planet, still fearful of the universe even centuries later, even with all of their power. 
The world of the Folk is a world of magic, and the Folk are a magical people.

Humans once wielded formidable magical power. But with over 7 billion of us on the planet now, Mana has spread far too thinly to have any effect. When hostile aliens reduce humanity to a mere fraction, the survivors discover an old power has begun to reawaken once again.

They had survived, but there weren't many of them. And the environment, terrain, the whole world had been nearly destroyed before the aliens got what they wanted and left. 
The survivors had to learn to live with the new world they found themselves in.
 Unfortunately most of their higher level scientists had perished. And even the tech, and other skilled workers that remained were too few, and the infrastructure they were used to working in was destroyed. 
They had to rebuild from scratch.
 And it did not go well at first. There began to be the general feeling that humanity would decline and go back to the Medieval ages at best. 
But then, a few people began to notice something.
 The old symbols of magic that had long been kept as ancient curiosities and good luck charms began to work again. Fire was easier to start for those carrying fire charms. People with health charms didn't get sick. And so on. 
It was a slow process, but the survivors began to realize that they were no longer completely helpless.
 They began experimenting, and new job types were created. The scientists that were left studied the phenomena, and concluded that they couldn't figure out where the power was coming from, but they were pretty sure everyone had access to it to a greater or lesser degree.
